subject: Sexual Health
title: Anxiety and Sexual Performance
description: A quick win: understand Anxiety and Sexual Performance.

hook.text: Performance anxiety creates a vicious cycle. Worrying about sex makes the body unable to respond to sex.

buildup.text: Anxiety activates the sympathetic nervous system, which constricts blood vessels and blocks arousal.

discovery.text: The prefrontal cortex goes into overdrive, monitoring performance instead of experiencing pleasure.

twist.text: Spectatoring, watching yourself during sex instead of being present, is a cognitive pattern that worsens anxiety.

climax.text: Mindfulness techniques and cognitive therapy break the cycle by shifting the brain back to sensory experience.

punchline.text: The mind that worries about sex prevents it from happening.

quiz.question: What is spectatoring in the context of sexual anxiety?
options: Mentally monitoring your own performance during sex
